SEARCH
Package tradedatacorp.smelter.filesmelter

Class OHLCV_BinaryLexicalSmallFileSmelter

java.lang.Object
tradedatacorp.smelter.filesmelter.OHLCV_BinaryLexicalSmallFileSmelter
All Implemented Interfaces:
FileSmelter<StickDouble>, FileSmelterStateful<StickDouble>, Smelter<StickDouble>, SmelterStateful<StickDouble>, StringSmelter<StickDouble>, StringSmelterStateful<StickDouble>
public class OHLCV_BinaryLexicalSmallFileSmelter extends Object implements StringSmelterStateful<StickDouble>, FileSmelterStateful<StickDouble>
This class writes StickDouble types to a compressed binary file that is formated to an OHLCV_BinaryLexical binaryTranslator. This class is a functional prototype that will be used as a blueprint for OHLCV_BinaryLexicalSmallFileSmelter.

    • writeDataToNewFile

      public String writeDataToNewFile(Path file, ArrayDeque<boolean[]> dataQueue, boolean toFile)
      The core function that is used to write binary data in dataQueue to to file.
      Parameters:
      file - the target file Path where binary data will be written; the file will be created or overwritten. This will have no relevance if toFile is true.
      dataQueue - a queue of boolean arrays, each representing a single data record to serialize and write. * NOTE: If binaryLexical bits change, the dataQueue boolean[] may be incompatible with change.
      toFile - will write to specified file if true, otherwise will return content of file as string
      Returns:
      The content of the binary file. If toFile is false then will return null Each character represents an 8 bit ASCII char value. NOTE: Java primitive char's are 16 bits but should be treated as 8 bits.

    • setTargetFile

      public void setTargetFile(Path path)
      Sets the preset target file path for future file write operations.
      Parameters:
      path - the Path file location.

    • setTargetFile

      public void setTargetFile(String relativePathName)

      Parameters:
      relativePathName - The path of the file for default write operations.
